sn15.11:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī.
sn15.11:4.4: No first point is found of sentient beings roaming and transmigrating, hindered by ignorance and fettered by craving.
sn15.11:4.5: When you see someone in a bad way, in distress, you should conclude:
sn15.11:4.6: ‘In all this long time, we too have undergone the same thing.’
sn15.11:4.7: Why is that? Transmigration has no known beginning. …
sn15.11:4.8: This is quite enough for you to become disillusioned, dispassionate, and freed from all conditions.”
